javadoc:
A {@link GFileSystemFactory} interface for filesystem implementations that need all available references to the source file, including a {@link ByteProvider}.

@param

methods.name: create
methods.comment: Constructs a new GFileSystem instance that handles the specified file.

params.name: containerFSRL
params.comment: the FSRL of the file being opened.

params.name: targetFSRL
params.comment: the FSRLRoot of the filesystem being created.

params.name: byteProvider
params.comment:
a ByteProvider containing the contents of the file being probed.
 This method is responsible for closing this byte provider instance.

params.name: containerFile
params.comment:
the File (probably in the filecache with non-useful filename)
 being opened.

params.name: fsService
params.comment: a reference to the FileSystemService object

params.name: monitor
params.comment:
a TaskMonitor that should be polled to see if the user has
 requested to cancel the operation, and updated with progress information.

throws.comment: if there is an error reading files.

name: GFileSystemFactoryFull
comment:
A GFileSystemFactory interface for filesystem implementations that need all available
 references to the source file, including a ByteProvider.
